content.body:
In order for the Listing Scan to search for your potential client's Google Business Profile listings, you must add your Google Places API key to Yext.





To add Google to your Listing Scan:





1. Create a Project in the Google Developer Console.



   1. Log into the [Google Developer Console](https://console.developers.google.com).
   2. Click **Library** in the sidebar.
   3. Click **Select a project** in the upper\-left corner. A dialog box appears.



      * If you don't see **Select a project**, click on the project name in the upper\-left corner.




   4. Click **NEW PROJECT**.
   5. Enter a **Project name**.
   6. If applicable, select a parent organization or folder:



      1. Click **BROWSE**. A dialog box appears.
      2. Select an organization or folder.
      3. Click **SELECT**.




   7. Click **CREATE**.




2. Enable the Places API.



   1. Click on the project name in the upper\-left corner. A dialog box appears.



      * If you don't see a project name, click **Select a project** in the upper\-left corner.




   2. Select your project and click **OPEN**.
   3. If applicable, click **Library** in the sidebar to access the API Library, otherwise Search for: Places API.
   4. Click on the **Places API**card.
   5. Click **ENABLE**.




3. Add credentials to your project.



   1. Click **Credentials** in the sidebar.
   2. Click on the **Credentials in APIs \& Services** link.
   3. Click **+ CREATE CREDENTIALS** at the top of the page and select **API key** from the drop\-down menu. A dialog box appears.
   4. Click on the **Edit API key** link.
   5. Enter a **Name** for the key (e.g., Yext API Key).
   6. Select **IP addresses (web servers, cron jobs, etc.)**.
   7. Click **ADD AN ITEM**.
   8. Enter the following IP addresses in separate text boxes. Click **ADD AN ITEM** after adding each IP address to create a new text box. After you add the last IP address click **DONE**.



      * 70.42.219.0/24
      * 64.94.163.176/28
      * 216.52.179.64/26
      * 216.52.128.128/28




   9. Select **Restrict key**.
   10. Click **Select APIs**, select **Places API** from the drop\-down menu, and click **OK**.
   11. Click **SAVE**.




4. Click on the Copy API Key icon to obtain your API key.
5. Add the API key to your Yext account.



   1. Log into your Yext account.



      * **Partner Portal:** Navigate to the **Account** tab in your portal and skip to step d.




   2. Click on the Account Details icon in the navigation bar and click **Account Settings**.
   3. Click **Account** in the **Partner Settings** section.
   4. Click on the **Google Places API Key**field and enter your API key.




6. (Optional) Increase your quota.




   1. In the Google Developer Console click on the **Manage service accounts** link in the bottom\-right corner of the **Credentials** page.
   2. Click **Quotas** in the sidebar.
   3. Select the checkbox in the quota panel to adjust the setting.
   4. Click **EDIT QUOTAS**.
   5. Enter the desired quota limit in the textbox.



      * Note: In order to increase the daily quota you must enable billing. For more information, see Google's [Create, Modify, or Close Your Billing Account](https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how\-to/manage\-billing\-account?hl=en_US&_ga=2.267829390.\-1626875908.1540923110) article.




   6. Click **DONE**.
   7. Click **SUBMIT REQUEST**.




      * For each Listing Scan that you or your clients perform, the scan will generate 4 requests to the Google Places API.
      * For more information, see Google's [APIs and Billing](https://support.google.com/cloud/answer/6158867?hl=en) article.

helpstarter_helpArticleBodyMarkdown.markdown:
In order for the Listing Scan to search for your potential client’s Google Business Profile listings, you must add your Google Places API key to Yext.

To add Google to your Listing Scan:

  1. Create a Project in the Google Developer Console.
    1. Log into the Google Developer Console.
    2. Click Library in the sidebar.
    3. Click Select a project in the upper-left corner. A dialog box appears.
      • If you don't see Select a project, click on the project name in the upper-left corner.
    4. Click NEW PROJECT.
    5. Enter a Project name.
    6. If applicable, select a parent organization or folder:
      1. Click BROWSE. A dialog box appears.
      2. Select an organization or folder.
      3. Click SELECT.
    7. Click CREATE.
  2. Enable the Places API.
    1. Click on the project name in the upper-left corner. A dialog box appears.
      • If you don’t see a project name, click Select a project in the upper-left corner.
    2. Select your project and click OPEN.
    3. If applicable, click Library in the sidebar to access the API Library, otherwise Search for: Places API.
    4. Click on the Places API card.
    5. Click ENABLE.
  3. Add credentials to your project.
    1. Click Credentials in the sidebar.
    2. Click on the Credentials in APIs & Services link.
    3. Click + CREATE CREDENTIALS at the top of the page and select API key from the drop-down menu. A dialog box appears.
    4. Click on the Edit API key link.
    5. Enter a Name for the key (e.g., Yext API Key).
    6. Select IP addresses (web servers, cron jobs, etc.).
    7. Click ADD AN ITEM.
    8. Enter the following IP addresses in separate text boxes. Click ADD AN ITEM after adding each IP address to create a new text box. After you add the last IP address click DONE.
      • 70.42.219.0/24
      • 64.94.163.176/28
      • 216.52.179.64/26
      • 216.52.128.128/28
      • 69.25.87.0/24
    9. Select Restrict key.
    10. Click Select APIs, select Places API from the drop-down menu, and click OK.
    11. Click SAVE.
  4. Click on the Copy API Key icon to obtain your API key.
  5. Add the API key to your Yext account.
    1. Log into your Yext account.
      • Partner Portal: Navigate to the Account tab in your portal and skip to step d.
    2. Click on the Account Details icon in the navigation bar and click Account Settings.
    3. Click Account in the Partner Settings section.
    4. Click on the Google Places API Key field and enter your API key.
  6. (Optional) Increase your quota.
    1. In the Google Developer Console click on the Manage service accounts link in the bottom-right corner of the Credentials page.
    2. Click Quotas in the sidebar.
    3. Select the checkbox in the quota panel to adjust the setting.
    4. Click EDIT QUOTAS.
    5.  Enter the desired quota limit in the textbox.
      • Note: In order to increase the daily quota you must enable billing. For more information, see Google’s Create, Modify, or Close Your Billing Account article.
    6. Click DONE.
    7. Click SUBMIT REQUEST.
      • For each Listing Scan that you or your clients perform, the scan will generate 4 requests to the Google Places API.
      • For more information, see Google’s APIs and Billing article.

content.name: Add Google to your Listing Scan
